title: Erik Erikson
summary: Erik Homburger Erikson (born Erik Salomonsen; 15 June 1902 â€“ 12 May 1994) was a Danish-German-American developmental psychologist and psychoanalyst known for his theory on psychological development of human beings.  He is probably most famous for coining the phrase identity crisis. His son, Kai T. Erikson, is a noted American sociologist.
